meanings.definition: The act of despoiling or plundering.
meanings.sent1: The despoilments of the village left everyone in despair.
meanings.sent2: The thieves carried away the despoilments from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The despoilments of the picnic basket by the ants was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The despoilments of trust in their relationship were irreparable.
meanings.sent5: The despoilments of nature by pollution are a serious concern.

meanings.definition: Items taken by force or theft.
meanings.sent1: The despoilments included valuable jewelry and electronics.
meanings.sent2: The burglars were caught with the despoilments in their possession.
meanings.sent3: The despoilments from the store were returned by the remorseful thief.
meanings.sent4: The despoilments of the treasure chest were a pirate's dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The despoilments of the ancient artifacts were recovered by the authorities.

meanings.definition: The result of spoiling or ruining something.
meanings.sent1: The despoilments of the cake were evident in its collapsed layers.
meanings.sent2: The despoilments of the garden were caused by the harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The despoilments of the surprise party were accidentally revealed.
meanings.sent4: The despoilments of the painting were due to improper storage.
meanings.sent5: The despoilments of the friendship were caused by misunderstandings.
